topic.title: Firmware Download Command

body.p: MRPC Command ID: 0x05

The Firmware Download command is used to update firmware and configuration data on the board. The Firmware Download command can support Bootloader/partition map/firmware/configuration file/ seeprom data download.
There are five sub commands:

Downloading firmware and configuration data to the switch is a multi-stage operation that uses multiple sub-commands to complete. The download data is split into multiple data packets that are transferred by issuing multiple Download sub-commands. Each Download sub-command can transfer up to (1,024 byte MRPC Input Data Region) - (16 byte Download header) = 1,008 bytes.

Different flash memories have a wide range of erase and write times. To avoid slow flash accesses from blocking other MRPC commands, a background thread is created at the beginning of a firmware download operation and released after the download is complete. Refer to Firmware Download - Usage Details for more details on usage of the Firmware Download command.
The Firmware Download sub-commands share a set of MRPC Command Return Values, as summarized in Table 1.

table.title: MRPC Firmware Download Command Return Values

entry.p: The handler thread is not idle
No background thread run for the command
Flash layout in partition map is not correct
The XML version between MAIN_FW and CFG is not matched
The handler thread is not idle
No background thread run for the command
Flash layout in partition map is not correct
The XML version between MAIN_FW and CFG is not matched

topic.domains: (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic struct-d) (topic firmware-d) (topic pmcrevhis-d)
topic.title: Firmware Download - Get Status Sub-Command

body.p: The Get Status sub-command is used to check the status of a firmware download procedure. This includes checking the status and progress of an on-going firmware download operation, as well as checking the failure state of a failed download.

table.title: Firmware Download Command Get Status Input Data

body.p: Specifies the Firmware Download Sub-Command. Set to 0x0 for the Get Status operation.

table.title: Firmware Download Command Get Status Output Data

body.p: This field indicates the overall state of the firmware download procedure:

ul.li: 0x05 - Error - Mismatch between the image length sent and the length of the download header
0x06 - Error - Hardware errors, such as wrong packet CRC from Switchtec
0x07 - Success - Download completed and new image has been activated
0x08 - Success - Download completed and the new image needs to be activated.
0x0D - Error - Download failed due to the partition is read-only
0x0F - Error - SEEPROM or related TWI bus isn't enabled

body.p: If this field is 0x01 (Download in progress, no error), a firmware image or configuration data is downloading and a new download procedure should not be initiated. The switch firmware will reject all new download commands while one is in the process of downloading.
Values 0x2 to 0x6 indicate that the last download operation has completed in a failure state. A new download procedure can be initiated.
Values 0x7 to 0x8 indicate that the last download operation has completed successfully. A new download procedure can be initiated.
Value 0xA indicates that authentication check failed when authentication is enabled.
Value 0xB indicates that signature memory is allocated failed.
Value 0xC indicates that downloading a SEEPROM image failed.
Value 0xD indicates that the target partition is read-only and cannot be updated.

Value 0xE indicates that the most recent download operation failed due to timeout error. For frmware download timeout value confguration, see Firmware Download Timeout Value. A new download procedure can be initiated.

During a firmware download, the firmware image and configuration data are split into multiple data packets, and each packet is burned into flash by a background thread. This field indicates the download status of a data packet:

ul.li: 0x01 - Background thread is burning the data packet into flash
0x02 - Background thread has burned the data packet into flash

topic.domains: (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic struct-d) (topic firmware-d) (topic pmcrevhis-d)
topic.title: Firmware Download - Download Sub-Command

body.p: The Download sub-command is used to write firmware download data packets.

table.title: Firmware Download Command Download Input Data

body.p: Specifies the Firmware Download Sub-Command. Set to 0x1 for the Download operation.
This field specifies whether the download is activated automatically on completion:
0 - Image is activated after download is complete
1 - Image is not activated after download is complete

note.p: When this flag is set, the Toggle sub-command must be used to activate the downloaded image.

body.p: The data offset in the download data.
The file length in bytes of the firmware image.
The number of valid bytes in the Data field.
Up to 1,008 bytes of download data.
There is no output data for this sub-command.

topic.domains: (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic struct-d) (topic firmware-d) (topic pmcrevhis-d)
topic.title: Firmware Download - Toggle Sub-Command

body.p: The Toggle sub-command is used to toggle the active firmware image or configuration data. It is used to activate a newly downloaded image, or to revert to a previous, known-good image.

table.title: Firmware Download Command Toggle Input Data

body.p: Specifies the Firmware Download Sub-Command. Set to 0x2 for the Toggle operation.
This field indicates if the firmware partition should be toggled or not:

ul.li: 0 - Do not toggle the firmware partition

body.p: This field indicates if the data partition should be toggled or not:
This field indicates if the BL2 partition should be toggled or not:
There is no output data for this sub-command.

topic.title: Firmware Download - Valid Partition Map Sub-Command

body.p: The Valid Partition Map sub-command is used for in-band partition map upgrade. In-band partition map upgrade procedure see SPI Flash Partition Layout

The Valid Partition Map sub-command (0x3) checks that the flash layout of the parition map and the parition map itself are correct. If incorrect, an error will be flagged. The return values are listed in Table 1. For errors related to this sub-command, there are two possible values:

ul.li: 0x00064008 - Flash layout in partition map is not correct; or

table.title: Firmware Download Command Reread partition map Input Data

body.p: Specifies the Firmware Download Sub-Command. Set to 0x3 for the valid partition map operation.
There is no output data for this sub-command.

topic.title: Firmware Download - Set/Get Bootloader Read-only Status Sub-Command

body.p: The bootloader partition of flash is critical, it's flagged to be Read-Only to avoid being updated inadvertently. It's necessary for Switchtec users to remark it to be Read-Write attribution when download a new bootloader .

table.title: MRPC FW Download subcmd - Set/Get BootLoader Read-Only status input

body.p: Specifies the Firmware Download Sub-Command -Set/Get Bootloader Read-Only status
1: Set the bootloader status
0: Get the bootloader status
1: To be RO status
0: To be RW status
This field is effective in the Set Bootloader Status Operation

table.title: MRPC FW Download subcmd - Get BootLoader Read-Only Status output

body.p: 1: RO (Read-Only) status
0: RW (Read-Write) status
Note: No output data for the Set Bootloader Status operation

topic.domains: (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic struct-d) (topic firmware-d) (topic pmcrevhis-d)
topic.title: Firmware Download - Usage Details

body.p: The Follow the following steps for firmware download.

li.p: If While downloading bootloader, issue Set/Get bootloader Read-only Only Status sub-command to change bootloader partition to writable since it is read-only by default set bootloader partition Read-Write status.

ol.li: Check the Download Status field at 0x400 to confirm it is not 0x01 (Download in progress, no error). If it is 0x1, then a firmware download operation is in progress and a new one cannot be initiated.

Issue the Download sub-command to flash a data packet.
After download sub-command process completed , Switchtec sends an asynchronous notification to the requester.

Issue the Get Status sub-command to check if the packet has been burned into flash successfully completely processed and stored in flash:
Issue the Get Status sub-command.
Check the Download Status field at 0x400 to confirm it is 0x01 (Download in progress, no error).
Check the Background Process Status field at 0x401 to confirm it is 0x02 (Background thread has burned completely processed and stored the data packet into in flash).
Repeat steps 3 and 4 4 and 5 until all data packets have been sent to the firmware.

li.p: When the last data packet has been programmed written, the expected Download Status should be 0x7, or 0x8, depending on the activation settings and whether a firmware image or configuration data was flashed.

If the Download Status is 0x8, issue the Toggle sub-command to activate the new downloaded data. If the Download status is 0xE, the download failed due to timeout; return to step 3 to restart download.
li.ph: f the Download status is 0xE, the download failed due to timeout; return to step 3 to restart download.

li.p: If download bootloader a new bootloader was downloaded, issue Set/Get bootloader Read-Only Status sub-command to set bootloader partition Read-Only status.

body.note: The firmware update process slows the switch processor's ability to respond to system interrupts. Operations that generate systems interrupts include hot/surprise remove, hot/surprise add, cable plugging, cable pulling, heavy traffic loads, and error handling procedures. As a result, Microsemi recommends that system traffic is quiesced and hardware is not reconfigured while performing an in-field firmware update.

note.p: There is a 4K buffer in firmware to store the data of image from host packet, and firmware will not burn the packet to Flash until either the 4K buffer is full, or all data of image has received. So in Step 4, the Download Status will be 0x0 (Ready for download) and image data has been received (the last data packet may be smaller than 4K). The download status becomes 0x1 (Download in progress) right after the first packet has been received from the host. The background process status will also be 0x1 when the background thread stores the data packet into 4K buffer or flash. The Background Process Status will be 0x0 (idle) at the beginning until 4K data has been received and burned to Flash 0x2 (burned the data packet into flash) after the data download command is processed, regardless if the data is put into the 4K buffer or hits the 4K boundary when writing to flash.

body.p: This procedure is illustrated in Figure 1 and Figure 2.The following illustration needs updating to reflect the step 1 and step 9 that are new added in MR-1

note.p: It is recommended that use "Image Activation Option = 1" to download images. After all images are downloaded, use Toggle subcommand to activate the new images. The following is download sequence for different cases:

li.p: If just download one image: configuration file image
Issue the Download subcommand with option Image Activation Option = 1 to update configuration file image;
Then issue the Toggle subcommand with option Toggle Data Partition = 1 to activate the new configuration image;
If just download one image: main FW image
Issue the Download subcommand with option Image Activation Option = 1 to update main FW image;
Then issue the Toggle subcommand with option Toggle Firmware Partition = 1 to activate the new main FW image;
If download two images: configuration file image and main FW image
Issue the Download subcommand with option Image Activation Option = 1 to update configuration file image and main FW image separately;
Then issue the Toggle subcommand with option Toggle Firmware Partition = 1 and Toggle Data Partition = 1 to activate the new configuration image and main FW at one time;
